defaultProjects.name: Open Power Quality
defaultProjects.description: Open source hardware and software for distributed power quality data collection, analysis, and visualization.

defaultProjects.name: RadGrad
defaultProjects.description: Growing awesome computer scientists, one graduate at a time.

defaultProjects.name: WRENCH
defaultProjects.description: WRENCH is an open-source library for developing simulators for large-scale scientific computation

defaultProjects.name: Cyber Canoe

defaultRecipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
defaultRecipes.description: Classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, and pancetta.
defaultRecipes.instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti in boiling water until al dente. 2. In a separate pan, fry pancetta until crispy. 3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese. 4. Drain cooked spaghetti and transfer to the pan with crispy pancetta. 5. Quickly add the egg mixture to the spaghetti and pancetta, stirring continuously to coat the pasta. 6. Season with black pepper to taste. 7. Serve immediately and enjoy!

defaultRecipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
defaultRecipes.description: Creamy pasta dish with tender chicken pieces and a rich Alfredo sauce.
defaultRecipes.instructions: 1. Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a skillet, cook diced chicken breasts until golden brown. 3. Add minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until fragrant. 4. Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. 5. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth and creamy. 6. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. 7. Toss cooked pasta in the Alfredo sauce until well coated. 8. Serve hot and garnish with additional Parmesan cheese if desired.

defaultRecipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
defaultRecipes.description: A colorful and nutritious stir-fry featuring an assortment of fresh vegetables.
defaultRecipes.instructions: 1. Heat cooking oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. 2. Add minced garlic and ginger to the skillet and cook until fragrant. 3. Add broccoli florets, sliced bell peppers, julienned carrots, snow peas, and sliced mushrooms to the skillet. 4. Stir-fry the vegetables until they are tender-crisp. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce and sesame oil. 6. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly. 7. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. 8. Serve hot as a delicious and nutritious meal!

defaultRecipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
defaultRecipes.description: Classic homemade cookies packed with chocolate chips.
defaultRecipes.instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper. 2. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. 3. In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until light and fluffy. 4. Beat in eggs one at a time until well combined. 5. Gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. 6. Stir in chocolate chips and chopped nuts if using. 7. Drop spoonfuls of cookie dough onto prepared baking sheets, leaving space between each cookie. 8. Bake in preheated oven for 8-10 minutes or until edges are golden brown. 9. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. 10. Enjoy these delicious homemade chocolate chip cookies with a glass of milk!

defaultRecipes.name: Lemon Bars
defaultRecipes.description: Delicious lemon bars with a buttery crust and tangy lemon filling.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Heat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
2. In a medium bowl combine flour, powdered sugar, and softened butter. Pat dough into prepared pan and bake for 15 minutes or until slightly golden brown. Set crust aside and leave oven on.
3. In a medium bowl whisk together eggs, sugar, flour, lemon juice, and food coloring until frothy. Pour lemon mixture over hot crust.
4. Return to heated oven for an additional 20 minutes, or until light golden brown.
5. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar.
6. Cut into squares. Serves 16.

defaultRecipes.name: Pork or Chicken Afritada
defaultRecipes.description: A flavorful Filipino stew made with tender pork or chicken, garbanzo beans, peas, and bell pepper.

ingredients.name: Lean pork or boneless skinless chicken
Red bell pepper, sliced or sliced pimientos
ingredients.quantity: 1 red bell pepper or 1/2 cup sliced pimientos

defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
2. Saute pork or chicken and garlic until brown. Drain excess fat.
3. Add water and cook, uncovered, on medium-high heat until liquid is reduced.
4. Add tomato sauce, vinegar, cinnamon sticks, bay leaf, salt, and pepper.
5. Stirring occasionally, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
6. Add garbanzo beans, peas, and bell pepper; cover and cook for 5 more minutes.
7. If using pimientos, add just before serving.
8. Discard cinnamon sticks and bay leaf. Serves 6.

defaultRecipes.name: Mochi
defaultRecipes.description: Delicious and chewy Japanese rice cakes made with mochiko and coconut milk.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Heat oven to 350°F.
2. Spray non-stick cooking spray in a 9x13-inch glass baking dish.
3. In a mixing bowl, sift mochiko, sugar, and baking powder; set aside.
4. In a separate large bowl, whisk coconut milk and water. Add vanilla and mix well.
5. Using a hand mixer, slowly add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, and mix until well blended.
6. Add food coloring to the batter and mix well until desired color is achieved.
7. Pour mixture into baking dish. Cover pan with foil, sealing it completely.
8. Bake for 1 hour. The edges may appear slightly hard and over-baked, while the center will appear moist.
9. Remove foil and cool completely.
10. Dust a clean flat surface with potato starch. Cut edges away from pan.
11. Turn baking dish of mochi out onto surface. Use a metal spatula, if necessary, to scrape the mochi out of the dish.
12. Cut mochi into small bite-sized cubes using a plastic knife. Roll mochi in potato starch, and dust off excess before serving.
13. Keeps for 1 day in an airtight container in a cool location. Store in refrigerator for 3-5 days; microwave for 10 seconds to soften. Makes 80 bite-size mochi.

defaultRecipes.name: Ti Leaf Pudding
defaultRecipes.description: A traditional Hawaiian dessert made with mochiko and brown sugar, steamed in ti leaves.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Oil ti leaves and sides of a 7 1/2 x 3-inch round pan. Line pan with leaves.
2. Dissolve brick sugar and raw sugar in hot water; cool.
3. Gradually add mochiko, stirring to make a thin batter; stir in salad oil.
4. Pour into prepared pan and steam for 4 hours or cook in a pressure cooker for 2-1/2 hours.
5. Garnish the center of the pudding with a dried red date and sprinkle the top with sesame seeds.
6. Makes 24 servings.

defaultRecipes.name: Eggnog Bread Pudding
defaultRecipes.description: A delicious holiday dessert made with eggnog, bread cubes, and warming spices.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Prepare bread by cutting it into quartered cubes and set aside.
2. Butter the bottom and sides of four small loaf pans (approximately 8”x4”x3”).
3. In a large pot, melt butter on medium-low heat, then add sugar until fully dissolved.
4. In a separate bowl, mix eggs, eggnog, vanilla, and salt.
5. Add one ladle of the warm milk mixture to the eggs, stirring constantly to prevent scrambling.
6. Add the egg mixture to the warm milk mixture, stirring constantly.
7. Turn off the heat and remove the pot from the heating element.
8. Add cinnamon and mix thoroughly.
9. Add bread cubes and mix until all pieces are drenched.
10. Immediately place the bread mixture into the buttered pans.
11. Cook in a preheated 350°F oven for 30-35 minutes. If a crispy top is desired, broil for 3-5 minutes.
12. Bread is best if it is a couple of days old.

defaultRecipes.name: Shepherd's Pie
defaultRecipes.description: A classic comfort food dish featuring seasoned ground beef, mixed vegetables, creamy mashed potatoes, and melted cheese.

ingredients.name: Russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes

defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. In a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat, heat olive oil for 1-2 minutes.
2. Add chopped onions and minced garlic. Cook for approximately 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add lean ground beef and break it apart with a wooden spoon.
4. Add Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Cook until the meat is browned.
5. Add tomato paste and water, stirring well to ensure there are no clumps of tomato paste.
6. Add frozen vegetable medley. Cook all ingredients thoroughly, then reduce heat to low and stir occasionally.
7. Preheat oven to 400°F.
8. Place potatoes in a large pot and submerge them with water. Bring water to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for approximately 10-15 minutes until potatoes are fork-tender.
9. Drain potatoes in a colander, then return them to the hot pot and let them rest for 1 minute.
10. Mash potatoes, then add butter, low-fat milk, salt, and pepper. Mix ingredients together well.
11. In a 9-by-9-inch baking dish, spread the meat mixture evenly.
12. Spoon the mashed potatoes on top of the meat into an even layer.
13. Sprinkle shredded cheese over the potatoes.
14. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until the cheese is golden.
15. Cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.

defaultRecipes.name: Roasted Butternut Squash Pasta
defaultRecipes.description: A delicious pasta dish featuring creamy roasted butternut squash sauce, shallots, garlic, and sage, served with rigatoni pasta.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Heat oven to 425°F.
2. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. Drizzle squash with 1/2 teaspoon olive oil, sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper, place cut side down on baking sheet.
4. Wrap shallots and garlic cloves in foil, drizzle with 1/2 teaspoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Wrap closed and place on the same baking sheet.
5. Place baking sheet in oven and bake for 30 minutes.
6. Remove pan from oven.
7. Scoop 1 cup of squash and transfer to a blender.
8. Add shallots, peeled garlic, water, cashews, 2 tablespoons olive oil, vinegar, sage, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.
9. Blend until creamy.
10. Cook rigatoni pasta according to directions on package in a pot of salted boiling water.
11. Reserve 1 cup of hot pasta water before draining.
12. Return rigatoni to pot, stir in sauce from blender, add 1/2 cup of the pasta water to loosen sauce and coat noodles.
13. Season with fresh thyme and serve.

defaultRecipes.name: Homemade Apple Butter
defaultRecipes.description: A delicious and versatile apple butter made with thinly sliced tart apples, brown sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla extract.

ingredients.name: Red delicious apples, peeled, seeded, and thinly sliced

defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. In a large pot, combine all ingredients.
2. Mix ingredients well.
3. Cover and cook on medium heat for 20 minutes; stir occasionally.
4. Bring to boil, reduce heat to medium-low and cook another 15-20 minutes or until apples are soft enough to mash with a fork.
5. Puree mixture with an immersion blender until desired texture. Avoid over blending to prevent mixture from becoming watery.
6. Enjoy on toast or over ice cream.

defaultRecipes.name: Slow Cooker Pork Chops
defaultRecipes.description: Tender and flavorful bone-in pork chops cooked to perfection in a savory cream of chicken soup mixture.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Roughly chop onion and place at the bottom of slow cooker.
2. Combine flour, soup mix, salt, garlic powder and Italian seasoning in a large bowl.
3. Evenly coat each side of pork chops with flour mixture.
4. In a large skillet, heat oil on medium heat. Place pork chops in skillet, browning each side for 2-3 minutes.
5. Place browned pork chops in slow cooker; top with cream of chicken soup.
6. Cook on high for 3-4 hours, or low for 4-5 hours.

defaultRecipes.name: Cowboy Caviar
defaultRecipes.description: A refreshing and flavorful salsa made with sweet corn, black beans, tomatoes, avocado, and a zesty dressing.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Add all ingredients in a large bowl, gently mix together.
2. Chill in refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
3. Serve with tortilla chips.

defaultRecipes.name: Slow Cooker Pork Stew
defaultRecipes.description: A hearty and flavorful pork stew cooked in a slow cooker with potatoes, onions, carrots, celery, and a savory seasoning mix.

ingredients.name: NOH brand Vinha D’alhos seasoning mix

defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Lightly season pork butt with garlic salt and black pepper. Set aside.
2. Place potatoes and onions in slow cooker.
3. Place pork butt on top.
4. Sprinkle NOH seasoning packet over everything.
5. Add water.
6. Cook on low for 8 hours, or high for 4 hours.
7. Halfway through cooking time, add chopped carrots and celery.
8. Mix cornstarch with water to create slurry, add to slow cooker to thicken gravy.
9. Add brown sugar.
10. Let stew cook for remaining time.
11. Stir before serving.

defaultRecipes.name: Warm Rice Pudding
defaultRecipes.description: A comforting and creamy rice pudding made with cooked rice, milk, sugar, and warm spices.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. In a medium saucepan, stirring constantly, cook rice with 1½ cups milk on stove at medium-high temperature (avoid boiling).
2. Cook for 20 minutes until rice is extremely soft and creamy.
3. Pour the rest of the milk on top of the mixture and pour the beaten egg on top of the cold milk.
4. Stir immediately.
5. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
6. Stir in butter and vanilla.
7. Place in serving bowls and lightly dust tops with cinnamon or nutmeg.
8. Eat immediately.
